comment: Best science teacher at KSU. The material is difficult but she makes it understandable. Tests are long, but not unreasonable, they correlate with the material. Skipping is the worst thing you could do for this class.

By far the best professor I have experienced at KSU. Test arent easy, study all the notes from the power points a week in advance and you should make an A. Attendance isnt mandatory but her tests come straight from the PPT which are not posted on D2L. You dont need the book, the lab manual is good enough. Take her if you can!

She is probably one of the best lecturers I've ever seen. Very clear cut and honest about her expectations and grading system. She will not give extra credit or bump a letter grade. Her tests are straight from her objectives (she will not stray from that) and if you do the work, an A is completely doable. Key is putting in the time. A&P is tough!

Con: She talks so fast, that you zone out and just write notes. She doesn't waste a minute, she has started a new chapter with 5 mins left on many occasions. Her test are 100 questions Pro: When you go to her office hours she will help you with whatever you need. Her test are from the objectives she gives and she doesn't stray from it. STUDY!

She has great reviews, however she does not live up to what her reviews say. She is not out to help you as a student. If you send an email she is very rude. The entire class consists of her flying through slides while talking the entire time. I have seen her fail students from a .001 point difference. She will not hear anyone out let alone help.

Very tough class.  Teacher doesn't take attendance but her test come directly from the lecture powerpoint presentations that are not posted on D2L.  As long as you show up to class, take notes (or pix of powerpoint) and study the notes an A in the class is possible.  Test are hard but there are usually a few bonus questions to help out.

AMAZING TEACHER!! I was really nervous about how hard this class was going to be, but Mrs. Laser-Hansen made sure you were very prepared for the tests. She gives you learning objectives for each exam and goes over them in class in great detail. I went to class AND read my textbook. With all of that effort, I made a 93 in the class.

Great professor. She does not put the notes online so you do need to go to class to take notes. She doesn't take attendance. Her learning objectives let you know everything you must know for the exams. Very clear with what you must know. If you put in the effort, it is not difficult to make an A! Take her!!!
She is an amazing professor, I do recommend for this class. She makes this class so clear, and easy. And she is very helpful. Study your objective and you'll get an easy A

Laser-Hansen is a GREAT professor! She has a list of objectives for each test. If it's not on the objectives, it's not on the test. The class does require a lot of work, but if you know the objectives for each test, you will do fine! I worked my butt off and got an A. TAKE HER!!
Did not like her as a lab teacher at all, worked my butt off, came to every class! its way too much information and she doesn't narrow anything down whatsoever!

This is a HARD class...I made over a thousand flashcards and filled up almost 2 notebooks worth of notes. But my favorite things about her are that she makes the objectives very clear, and she tells you exactly what you need to learn on your own. Definitely possible to get an A if you put in the time. Go to class!

She is an amazing teacher.Loved her teaching method. I learned a lot. She knows what she's talking about and knows how to explain it very well. GO TO CLASS! She also doesn't test you on everything from the book. Her test questions come from her notes. Reading the text book is extremely helpful as well but her class notes are what help the most.

One of the best Bio2221 professors! If you did not take anatomy in high school, this will be difficult for you, but if you study hard, take notes, and follow the objectives, you should do fine.For 8am MWF there's 5 tests and a final and for TR 5pm there's 3 tests and final. Highly recommend 8am: more tests=more chances to get an A.

Great teacher. Gives outline of what will be on the test and lectures over that. Class isn't mandatory, but should definitely go for better understanding. Tests were multiple choice mostly, short answer only for physiology. She also gave quizzes online that were open book over independent objectives. I would definitely recommend taking her.
Laser-Hansen is extremely nice. She is also really clear about what will be on tests. Anatomy is a hard subject but she makes it enjoyable and completely possible to get an A.

Professor Laser-Hansen is a good professor. She is hard, but fair. She gives you clear, concise instructions on what she expects from you. Her objectives are spot on and that's where her tests come from. Her exam questions are tough though. I study my butt off and got an A. This is what this class requires, put in the hard work & you will do well!

The Subject is a hard one & requires extra reading to fully understand the concepts. She is very helpful and clearly explains her power-points which she doesn't make available to students. Interestingly she allows you 2practically take down all the info as she explains the materials. class is not mandatory but do urself a favor and attend. Got an A

It's a hard class so be sure to study.  She gives you all the information you need to know in her learning objectives.  She never goes off those on the exams.  I mainly studied from the learning objectives and then went to the text/extra resources for materials I didn't understand and got an A in her class.

Professor Laser-Hansen knows her information.  She is thorough and accurate.  The class is difficult and much reading is required in order to pass.  It is not a class that can be slacked in at all.  Supplemental Information sessions were provided and were helpful.  I enjoyed this professor and only felt overwhelmed when I had not read my material.

REALLY nice and approachable. Willing to help with difficult concepts and returns emails when you have questions about things. If you study and know everything on her objectives-you will do fine on the tests. Anatomy is a hard subject and requires a lot of studying so be prepared to spend lots of time on this class. Definantly take her!
I find her lectures easy to understand but I also read/study chapters before coming. Very helpful to have objectives. I think she is fair and helpful.

Mrs. Laser-Hansen is so thorough about what she wants you to know for the tests. She gives learning objectives on Vista, which are similar to her notes. Her notes are given in class, which sucks because many students had a hard time writing the notes fast and paying attention to what she says @ the same time. But overall, She's great!!!
I found her to be extremely helpful and very approachable!!

She will answer any and all questions in lab. Lab is basically about memorization. I took photos pointing to every structure that was required to know for the exam and made A's on both. Also ask her to show you the structures under the microscope it really helps. Take pictures of everything including the keys. Form study groups! Take her!!!!!!

She is the best! 3 Exams, multiple choice & T/F. Use the book website by taking the chapter quizzes quite a few exam questions are identical along with the diagrams for the exam. 3 online quizzes basic definitions 10 questions each quiz. Use the learning objectives to study and make study groups!Final is old test questions nothing tricky!

This is for A&P LAB, Lets face it...this is not an easy class no matter what professor you have. However, with that said. Dr. Laser-Hansen moves too fast through the instructional portion of lab and counts off for spelling on the tests (which cost me an A) and she doesnt budge on her rules. She is however very helpful in class and a sweet lady.
She goes really fast in lectures which may seem overwhelming, but she has everything you need to know for the test laid out in her own objectives which have the answers as well unlike the A&P site

Just took the class.... You have to study a lot to get the grade you want. I honestly think her lectures were very easy to understand. A lot of material to cover which make the class hard. But if you wait to the last minute it will be EXTREMELY difficult to understand. As for lab a lot of material but again you have to do a lot of studying to get t

She was helpful. Tests were not easy. Need to study hard! This class is made to test you so don't blame the professor. If you go to her office, she will help you. She talks alot but she gets the point across. You will need time to study! Her outlines were a BIG help!!!

This is for 2221L (lab). I completely agree with the previous poster about how she doesn't label the cat and then you are tested on it and you have to hope you were right. Compared to other profs her exams are way out in left field. Do yourself a favor and take someone else!

Extremely difficult. Exams totally different from one to the next so you can't get a feel for testing style. Boring- practically reads right out of the book. Objectives don't line up with lecture. Rep. for being hardest in dpt. lives up to reputation. Posts every grade on web ct. For the final this was the breakdown: As-7 Bs-21 Cs-32 Ds-34 Fs- 35
very effective at teaching. makes all the material easy to understand

had her for lab. She was very helpful. Prepare for lab well, schedule and come to review sessions, print histology slides from KSU A&P website to bring them to class to ask her for what u need to focus on. Those r a few things I did and I scored really well. Good luck.

I had her for A&PII lab.  I didn't think she was that great.  She was helpful when you asked for help, but otherwise was not.  Unlike other teachers, she doesn't label the cats for you, so you just have to guess at what your looking at, and then get tested on it and hope you were right.  I think she could have been a bit more helpful.

I had her for the lab class. She is very helpful and she knows what she is talking about.  She tries to scare people into studying for tests and in general and it works!  Put some effort into it and it shouldn't be too hard.

Lab class. VERY helpful. Material is tough.  I worked hard for A.  Attendence is not mandatory but you must come to keep up and to get attendance/worksheet points (20%).  2 tests for 40% each.  25 stations on test with 4 questions per station.  2 min per station with chance to review stations at end.  Blood vessels tough.  Study guide provided.

Took her for AP1 Lab. she's amazing! VERY knowledgable and very kind and considerate. the tests are only hard because...well, anatomy and physiology IS hard. but she was completely fair. lab assignments due every week, but she just checks for completion, not for accuracy...and has a key to check answers with. definitely recommend her!

Professor Laser-Hansen is kind and helpful. She wants to make such hard material easy for you to understand. And for the most part, she does a great job at it. I really liked her... so much that I'm taking her for A+P 2. If you have to take lab, take her!
Only two test and each are extreemly hard, so study!! She is very nice and willing to help if needed.
She was helpful but the class itself consist of a lot of memorization.

She was a good teacher but her class was hard because there were not many grades only two tests and some class assignments. In this class u must study to pass if u dont understand what u are looking at in the lab u need to ask because it will be on the tests. Good Luck!
